page.title: 17METHODISM IN OUTWELL
page.content: {METHODISM IN THE VILLAGE OF OUTWELL Methodism was strongly established in Outwell by the mid-nineteenth century. 1844 Primitive Methodist Chapel founded 1851 United Methodist (Bethel) Church opened 1962 Wesleyan Chapel demolished 1962 First stone of St. Andrew's Methodist Church laid 1963 St. Andrew's Church opened on June 8th for the combined worship of the three congregations. The church is brick built and furnished in light coloured wood and cost Â£30,000 to build. There is an unusual gold coloured panel behind the Communion Table. Two stained glass windows have been put in since the building was completed. The Minister serves Outwell and Upwell and preaches at other chapels
